intro: Petrocoptis, commonly known as the rock scabious, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and clusters of small, often pink or white flowers. They are often used in ecological restoration projects due to their resilience and ability to stabilize soil.
